New Records: Hosein and Shepherd's 72-run ninth-wicket partnership set a record for a game involving a full ICC member
Key Match Events: England won by one run as West Indies plundered 28 runs in the final over
Akeal Hosein contributed 26 runs with three 6s and two 4s in the final over
Jason Roy and Moeen Ali put on 60 in partnership for the third wicket
Chris Jordan enjoyed another belligerent cameo
West Indies got off to a poor start as Reece Topley trapped opener Brandon King lbw and got rid of Shai Hope with a superb run-out
Pre-Game Insights: England captain Eoin Morgan noted that his team's strategy was to test the patience of the West Indies batsmen with a rhythm of 'dot, dot, dot, wicket, boundary'
Post-Match Reflections: West Indies captain Kieron Pollard said that his team's fielding display was a disappointment, but he was confident that they would overcome their struggles with spin bowling
England captain Eoin Morgan said that he was delighted with the win, even with the last quarter of the game
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at Kensington Oval in Bridgetown, Barbados
The five-match series is level at 1-1
